author: Paul Suttor
title: ‘I was shocked’: Heal hopes Thybulle snub won’t kill Boomers’ Olympic medal hopes in ‘Group of Death’
text:
Australia face an uphill battle in their hopes of emulating their breakthrough bronze medal of three years ago when the Paris Olympics tournament tips off this weekend.
Boomers legend Shane Heal is confident the Aussies can survive their intimidating draw to make the quarter-finals and play their way into the final four to have a shot at a medal.
But he is concerned the controversial omission of defensive specialist Matisse Thybulle could cost Brian Goorjian and his team when they match up against gigantic superstars like Greek lynchpin Giannis Antetokounmpo, French phenom Victor Wembanyama or Team USA’s tall timber.
The Boomers have not only been drawn in the dreaded “Group of Death” for the 12-team competition but they have slipped down the global pecking order since Patty Mills led them to their famous “rose gold” third-placed finish in Tokyo.
Olympic Games Paris 2024. Every Event. Ad-free. Live & On Demand. 4K. 8 Exclusive International channels from Eurosport, Viacom18 and Sky NZ, only on Stan Sport .
For Mills and long-time teammate Joe Ingles, this is their last chance to claim another medal at a major tournament after the disappointing 10th-placed finish at last year’s World Cup.
And they have to negotiate easily the toughest of the three pools of four with a Canada side stacked with elite NBA talent, Greece led by Antetokounmpo and perennial contenders Spain standing in their way.
Thybulle has his limitations as a scorer but Heal, who will be part of Stan Sport’s Olympics basketball coverage, said the Boomers could miss his extra length on the wings.
It was surprising to see a veteran like Matthew Dellavedova, natural treasure that he is, and Tasmania JackJumpers forward Jack McVeigh get the nod ahead of him.
“I was shocked that they didn’t take Matisse Thybulle,” Heal told The Roar .
Patty Mills and Matisse Thybulle at the Paris Olympics. (Photo by Ethan Miller/Getty Images)
“I thought he was one of their key guys and I’m still scratching my head about how he’s not in there because you’d think that he would have played a major role, particularly in some of the defensive assignments he would have got, even in the pool games.”
For Goorjian’s squad to make it to the pointy end of the Olympics, the young guns need to fire.
Josh Giddey has been charged with the responsibility of running the offence while fellow NBA lottery pick Dyson Daniels will be given the task of leading the perimeter defence.
“Some of the older guys will be playing their last Olympics with Joe Ingles and Patty Mills but with the new guys coming in, it’s Josh Giddey’s team now,” Heal said.
“With Dyson Daniels and Josh Green and these younger guys coming through, it’s a changing of the guard, but we’ve put together a really talented squad and they’ve got belief.
Shane Heal is a part of Stan Sport’s Olympics lineup, the only place to watch every event from Paris 2024 ad-free, live and on demand with 4K. With exclusive features including international multi-language channels and minis, go to Stan.com.au/Olympics for more info.
“I think they’re going to be in the mix for a medal.
“Giddey showed at the World Cup he’s up to this level. Even though the team didn’t perform that well, he had an amazing tournament and I think he’ll only grow from there.
“He’s an elite point guard in the world and I think the next NBA season with Chicago, I think he’s going to take another step forward as well.
“I think had we had a few more shooters on the perimeter, it would make it a little bit easier for him.”

Full Paris 2024 rugby sevens guide Stampeding Aussie sevens stun Argentina to top pool then conquer America to set up semi showdown with Olympic champs Olympics In Heal’s day when Gaze was starting alongside him in the backcourt, the offensive end was Australia’s strength but the modern crop of Boomers are don’t tend to be outside threats.
“We haven’t seen a lot of shooters come through with the men and women of late,” Heal said
“We used to be such a shooting nation. I think that’s what we were built on – grit and determination and toughness but it felt like we had shooters.
“It’s a bit of a weakness for the Boomers and it’s one of the areas that I’m a little bit concerned about. If Paddy isn’t hitting, then we don’t have another guy that’s known as a knockdown shooter.”
Heal thinks Australia’s frontcourt rotations of Jock Landale, Duop Reath, the ever-reliable Nick Kay and back-up centre Will Magnay will be imposing presences in the paint.
“I think Magnay was a good selection because he’s a real big body and he’s a shot blocker,” Heal added. “He’s more of a roller to the basket than anything else, but he’s a big, tough guy. I think he had some legitimate size for us.
“Nick Kay has been around for a while, is a great defender and plays a really good role as well. He’s got that toughness that I think can complement the other pieces of the team.”
Australia tip off their campaign on Saturday night at 7pm (AEST) against Spain before taking on second favourites Canada on Tuesday and Greece in their final pool game next Friday.
LeBron James is guarded heavily by Josh Green. (Photo by Christopher Pike/Getty Images)
“Canada’s got NBA players all over the place, they’re going to be extremely tough to beat. I think they’re the second best team in the tournament,” Heal said.
“They’re a little bit outside our reach. I hope I’m wrong, but they’ve got some legitimate NBA superstars like Shai Gilgeous-Alexander. And the core of that group played together in the World Cup, when they medalled (snaring bronze by beating USA).
“They’re going to be better than what they were last time. Then they’ve added Jamal Murray, an NBA champion, and Andrew Wiggins.
“I think we can beat Spain and Greece. And we have to. I mean, if we don’t, then we’re not going through. I don’t think Spain’s the same sort of level as what we’ve seen the Spanish teams in the past.
“Greece, it’s all about shutting down Giannis, basically. Giannis is just such a unique beast that it makes that game challenging because you have to throw so many different people and double teams and clog the floor. It will allow some of their shooters to get open.
“Landal and Reath have had a bit of experience against him and players like him (in the NBA) but I think Matisse would have been a great match-up for him. A little bit smaller, but quicker and athletic and able to get the ball out of his hands.
“I’m not sure who else they’re going to play because it’s not a natural fit. You think a Landale probably isn’t going to have the same quickness to be able to play with him. And Reath’s used to defending bigger guys.
“Giannis creates that match-up problem because whilst he’s the same size as those big guys, he’s got the quickness of a guard. So it’s going to be a massive challenge for the Boomers.
If they are to go deep in the tournament, the colossus of Team USA will be the greatest of obstacles to overcome with LeBron James, Steph Curry, Joel Embiid, Anthony Davis and Anthony Edwards headlining an all-star roster.
Shane Heal. (Photo by Mark Evans/Getty Images)
Heal said they have looked a bit vulnerable in their warm-up games, including a narrow win over Australia, but he suspected they were cruising before the real matches tip off.
“Once they get their systems right, they get their roles, they’re used to playing with each other, I think it’s going to be really difficult for anyone to beat them,” Heal predicted.
“I think Canada’s the best chance because they’ve got the firepower to really get hot. I’m not saying that they’re unbeatable, but I think you’re going to have to play really, really well and catch them on a bad night if you’re going to beat them.”
And while Heal has faith that the Boomers can overcome the odds to be one of the last four teams standing, he said it has never been tougher at the top with the rise of teams like Serbia, Canada, Germany and France.
“I just want to make sure the public understand how difficult it is. They’re going to have to win massive games to get into the top four,” he said.
“We’ve got more talent than we’ve ever had before, but it’s really tough to do it. They’re capable, and I think that they’ll get their opportunities. It’s just going to come down to whether you win those big crossover games against powerful opposition.”
The Barkley incident lives on The most famous moment of Heal’s career occurred 28 years ago when he was involved in a fracas with American superstar Charles Barkley in a warm-up match before the Atlanta Olympics.
Heal embodied the Boomers’ spirit of never backing down to anyone when he chest-bumped his much bigger superstar opponent in one of the iconic incidents in Australian sporting folklore.
With the Olympics rolling around, he probably gets asked about it again.
“It’s not just when the Olympics are on, I reckon I get asked about that every second day,” he said with a laugh.
“It’s resonated in people’s minds from back in the day as something they think of immediately.
“Some people don’t let the facts stand in the way of the story. They are like ‘oh, I remember when you got into it with that big Shaquille O’Neal’. And I’m like ‘yeah, close’.
“It’s the typical Australian way because everyone remembers the fight. I feel like saying ‘you know I had eight threes in that game, how about you remember that?’ It’s funny.”
Back then when the US were considered unbeatable, Heal and his contemporaries like Andrew Gaze would often say that they weren’t invincible and the day would come when another team would knock them off their throne.
It was only a relatively short time later that the unthinkable happened in the 2004 Olympics at Athens when they returned home with the bronze after Argentina beat them in the semis and then knocked over Italy in the gold medal game.
“At that time they were pretty invincible with the team and the legends that they put together,” Heal said of the 1996 line-up which also featured Hall of Famers Hakeem Olajuwon, Scottie Pippen, David Robinson, John Stockton and Karl Malone.
“But it’s interesting how time evolves as well and it was only a few years later when they lost.”

author: Andrea Zamorano
title: El PSOE anuncia una reforma legal para penalizar a los burdeles y erradicar la prostitución
text: El PSOE anuncia una reforma legal para penalizar a los burdeles y erradicar la prostitución Los socialistas recuperarán la ley abolicionista que quedó a medias en el Congreso en la anterior legislatura MadridEn la anterior legislatura el PSOE ya intentó avanzar en la abolición de la prostitución con [ una proposición de ley que no culminó su recorrido parlamentario en el Congreso](https://www.ara.cat/societat/comuns-desmarquen-votaran-no-tramitar-llei-abolicionista-psoe_1_4395920.html). Pero la ministra de Igualdad, Ana Redondo, ha anunciado este jueves que los socialistas volverán a intentarlo. En una comparecencia en la cámara baja para presentar las líneas generales del departamento que encabeza, Redondo ha explicado que el PSOE presentará "próximamente" una iniciativa para penalizar a los propietarios de los inmuebles donde se produzca una situación de explotación sexual (lo que se conoce como el delito de latercería locativa). Este delito quedará recogido en el Código Penal. "Es un primer paso", explicó Redondo, que avanzó que a lo largo de la legislatura irá "poniendo los ingredientes" para "erradicar" la explotación sexual. "El abolicionismo es una finalidad", aseveró. En este sentido, ha admitido que también será necesario ofrecer una alternativa de vida digna para las 60.000 mujeres que están en situación de prostitución en España, muchas de ellas de origen migrante, y que necesitan una solución residencial y laboral.- _BK_COD_ En la proposición de ley registrada en la anterior legislatura, el PSOE planteaba castigar con penas de entre dos y cuatro años de prisión y multa de 18 a 24 meses a quienes "con ánimo de lucro y de manera habitual destine un inmueble, local o establecimiento, abierto o no al público, o cualquier otro espacio, a promover, favorecer o facilitar la prostitución de otra persona”. Incluso cuando esta situación se produjera "con su consentimiento". Esto abría la puerta a sancionar a mujeres –propietarias del piso– que aseguraran que ejercían la prostitución por voluntad propia. Algunos colectivos de trabajadoras sexuales del Estado han denunciado reiteradamente que esto "criminaliza" a aquellas mujeres que "se organizan, trabajan y viven en el mismo sitio". Y, de hecho, este debate genera división a la izquierda y al propio gobierno de coalición. Los comunes, que defienden un planteamiento que regula la prostitución en lugar de abolirla –es decir, reconocer los derechos de las trabajadoras sexuales en lugar de perseguir estas prácticas– se desmarcaron y votaron en contra de tramitar la norma de los socialistas. Ahora bien, Podemos votó a favor. ERC, otro de los socios de la coalición, también se opuso. En cambio el PP le apoyó. Unos posicionamientos que previsiblemente se repetirán esta legislatura, en la que los socialistas ya han avisado a la convención política de este fin de semana de que recuperarían su hoja de ruta para perseguir el proxenetismo y abolir la prostitución.

author: Redacción
title: Megafarmacia: Xóchitl pide a AMLO no jugar con la salud del pueblo | Radio Fórmula
text: [La precandidata por la coalición conformada por PAN, PRI y PRD, Xóchitl Gálvez Ruiz,](https://www.radioformula.com.mx/nacional/2023/12/19/xochitl-deja-chamba-de-voceria-la-inteligencia-artificial-que-implica-794588.html) criticó de manera contundente la estrategia de salud implementada por el Gobierno Federal, encabezado por Andrés Manuel López Obrador, catalogándola como costosa y poco práctica. La iniciativa gubernamental busca transportar diariamente, mediante aviones y helicópteros, medicamentos almacenados en la megafarmacia ubicada en el Estado de México hacia diversas regiones del país. En ese sentido Gálvez Ruiz cuestionó el envío de medicamentos y sus costos. Xóchitl cuestiona la viabilidad del envío de medicamentos [La representante de Fuerza y Corazón por México ](https://www.radioformula.com.mx/nacional/2023/11/5/xochitl-galvez-busca-construir-un-mexico-mas-inclusivo-en-donde-mujeres-vivan-sin-violencia-788627.html)planteó preguntas válidas sobre la viabilidad de enviar un medicamento urgente desde Huehuetoca, Estado de México, hasta lugares distantes como Tijuana, Mérida o las remotas zonas montañosas de Guerrero. En ese sentido, Gálvez Ruiz argumentó en contra de la idea de contar con la megafarmacia más grande del mundo, subrayando que la verdadera necesidad de México radica en garantizar la disponibilidad de medicamentos en cada una de sus 190 mil localidades. Te podría interesar "La idea de una megafarmacia puede no sonar mal, pero eso de mandar medicamentos todos los días en avión y helicóptero es carísimo y absurdo. México no necesita la megafarmacia más grande del mundo. Lo que necesita es que haya medicinas en cada una de sus 190 mil localidades", señaló. Pide a AMLO no poner en riesgo la salud de la población En un video compartido en sus plataformas de redes sociales, [Xóchitl Gálvez instó al Presidente de la República](https://www.radioformula.com.mx/nacional/2023/12/27/video-xochitl-galvez-embiste-amlo-crisis-migratoria-no-se-resuelve-con-falsas-promesas-795472.html) a no poner en riesgo la salud de la población, especialmente la de los sectores más desfavorecidos. Haciendo hincapié en que este tema no debería ser politizado, sino considerado como una cuestión de vidas humanas, la precandidata solicitó al mandatario replantear sus decisiones. [Xóchitl Gálvez Ruiz](https://www.radioformula.com.mx/nacional/2023/11/20/xochitl-galvez-mi-propuesta-esta-basada-en-el-amor-no-en-el-odio-ni-en-la-division-790667.html) argumentó que aquellos mexicanos que viven en condiciones de pobreza enfrentan dificultades insuperables si, cada vez que un familiar enferma, deben desembolsar grandes sumas de dinero en medicamentos. En este sentido, cuestionó la megafarmacia y la prioridad que el Presidente otorga a los ciudadanos menos privilegiados, poniendo en duda si realmente son su principal preocupación.

author: Kimberly Hill
title: The Self-Confidence Project: Supporting Men to Attract Healthy Loving Relationships
text: The Self-Confidence Project: Supporting Men to Attract Healthy Loving Relationships Kimberly Hill is now opening her applications to work privately in the new yearVANCOUVER, CANADA, January 7, 2024 / [EINPresswire.com](https://www.einpresswire.com/)/ -- Named as one of the top ten dating experts of 2023, Kimberly Hill is a certified dating and relationship coach who supports good-hearted men to achieve healthy and loving relationships. As the new year draws nearer, Hill is happy to announce that she is now accepting applications for one to one sessions in dating and relationship coaching. Dating is not always easy for everyone, especially for men who just got out of a long term relationship or has decided to end a marriage. With this, Hill is eager to work with men who are determined to attract their dream relationship in the new year as she promises to provide a genuine, confidential, and a personalized assessment of one's dating approach. In her practice, she has supported over 250 men on a one on one basis to show up, lead, and start attracting their dream relationships. "If a man wants to break the pattern of poor relationships or attracting the wrong partners, he must first understand his unconscious partner selection and relational challenges," she added. Hill is also the host of The Self-Confidence Project, a podcast where she discusses everything from life, dating, divorce, and how to live a meaningful life. Through this platform, she has supported an audience of over 100,000 men with her direct and helpful advice. Apply now through this link to work with Kimberly Hill in finding love. For more information, visit [https://www.kimberlyninahill.com/](https://www.kimberlyninahill.com/). EL NUEVO DIARIO, SAN CRISTÓBAL. – La vicepresidenta, Raquel Peña, acompañada del titular del Servicio Nacional de Salud (SNS), entregó este jueves los remozados Centros de Primer Nivel (CPN) Básima y La Cuchilla, ubicados en el municipio de Villa Altagracia, con el objetivo de fortalecer la capacidad de respuesta temprana y aumentar la calidad en la atención medica en esta comunidad. 
La vicemandataria resaltó que la apertura de estos centros completamente renovados, representa un compromiso cumplido del Gobierno con la expansión y mejora de los servicios de salud en todas las regiones del país. 
De acuerdo a un comunicado, también precisó que desde hoy, las familias de Básima, desde los más jóvenes hasta los adultos mayores, tendrán a su alcance atención médica de primer nivel en las mejores condiciones sin tener que alejarse de su hogar. 

“Queremos que todos nuestros ciudadanos, sin importar dónde vivan, tengan acceso a una atención médica digna y cercana y lo estamos logrando”, destacó la presidenta del Gabinete de Salud 
Peña subrayó, además, que a través del Servicio Nacional de Salud, se está construyendo un sistema de salud con visión de futuro, que no se limita a las grandes ciudades, sino que llega a cada comunidad de la nación. 
Durante el acto de entrega, Mario Lama, director del SNS, resaltó el compromiso del Gobierno en fortalecer el sistema sanitario del país. “Recordemos en septiembre de este año entregamos la ampliada y remozada Emergencia del Hospital Municipal de Villa Altagracia y hoy avanzamos con estas renovaciones en estos centros, reafirmando nuestro compromiso y continuamos estirando los chelitos, como dice nuestro presidente Luis Abinader”. 

Igualmente, Lama señaló la transformación que ha dado la salud del pueblo en este Gobierno, ya que se han enfocado en asegurar y democratizar el acceso a los servicios público con más y mejores centros asistenciales, con la entrega de más de 60 hospitales completamente remozado y equipado, y alrededor de 600 unidades atención primaria en todo el país. 
El Centro de Primer Nivel (CPN) Básima, recibió una serie de mejoras y adecuaciones con una inversión de RD$ 15,651,285.40, en trabajos para la creación de un entorno funcional y cómodo para los pacientes y el personal médico, en beneficio a los más de cinco mil habitantes en la zona. 
Las remodelaciones en este centro abarcaron la adecuación de dos consultorios polivalentes, áreas de Vacuna, Urgencias, Farmacia, Sala de Espera y descanso de enfermería. Además, se habilitó una residencia médica equipada con sala-comedor, dos dormitorios, cocina y baño, brindando condiciones dignas para el personal de salud 
Mientras, en el Centro de Primer Nivel La Cuchilla, el Servicio Nacional de Salud, remozó con una inversión de 9.7 millones de pesos, permitiendo que esta comunidad, con una población de 6,200 habitantes, cuente con instalaciones adecuadas para recibir atención de salud oportuna y eficiente. 
La remodelación del CPN La Cuchilla incluyó dos consultorios polivalentes, áreas de Vacuna, Urgencias, Farmacia, Sala de Espera y una residencia médica con sala, comedor, dos dormitorios, cocina y baño.

"raquel-pena-entrega-dos-cpn-para-acercar-servicios-de-salud-en-villa-altagracia", "categories": [335058, 229942], "acf": [], "content_plaintext": "EL NUEVO DIARIO, SAN CRISTÓBAL. – La vicepresidenta, Raquel Peña, acompañada del titular del Servicio Nacional de Salud (SNS), entregó este jueves los remozados Centros de Primer Nivel (CPN) Básima y La Cuchilla, ubicados en el municipio de Villa Altagracia, con el objetivo de fortalecer la capacidad de respuesta temprana y aumentar la calidad en la atención medica en esta comunidad.
La vicemandataria resaltó que la apertura de estos centros completamente renovados, representa un compromiso cumplido del Gobierno con la expansión y mejora de los servicios de salud en todas las regiones del país.
De acuerdo a un comunicado, también precisó que desde hoy, las familias de Básima, desde los más jóvenes hasta los adultos mayores, tendrán a su alcance atención médica de primer nivel en las mejores condiciones sin tener que alejarse de su hogar.
Raquel Peña en Villa Altagracia (Foto: Fuente externa)
“Queremos que todos nuestros ciudadanos, sin importar dónde vivan, tengan acceso a una atención médica digna y cercana y lo estamos logrando”, destacó la presidenta del Gabinete de Salud
Peña subrayó, además, que a través del Servicio Nacional de Salud, se está construyendo un sistema de salud con visión de futuro, que no se limita a las grandes ciudades, sino que llega a cada comunidad de la nación.
Durante el acto de entrega, Mario Lama, director del SNS, resaltó el compromiso del Gobierno en fortalecer el sistema sanitario del país. “Recordemos en septiembre de este año entregamos la ampliada y remozada Emergencia del Hospital Municipal de Villa Altagracia y hoy avanzamos con estas renovaciones en estos centros, reafirmando nuestro compromiso y continuamos estirando los chelitos, como dice nuestro presidente Luis Abinader”.
Centros de Primer Nivel (CPN) Básima (Foto: Fuente externa)
Igualmente, Lama señaló la transformación que ha dado la salud del pueblo en este Gobierno, ya que se han enfocado en asegurar y democratizar el acceso a los servicios público con más y mejores centros asistenciales, con la entrega de más de 60 hospitales completamente remozado y equipado, y alrededor de 600 unidades atención primaria en todo el país.
El Centro de Primer Nivel (CPN) Básima, recibió una serie de mejoras y adecuaciones con una inversión de RD$ 15,651,285.40, en trabajos para la creación de un entorno funcional y cómodo para los pacientes y el personal médico, en beneficio a los más de cinco mil habitantes en la zona.
Las remodelaciones en este centro abarcaron la adecuación de dos consultorios polivalentes, áreas de Vacuna, Urgencias, Farmacia, Sala de Espera y descanso de enfermería. Además, se habilitó una residencia médica equipada con sala-comedor, dos dormitorios, cocina y baño, brindando condiciones dignas para el personal de salud
Mientras, en el Centro de Primer Nivel La Cuchilla, el Servicio Nacional de Salud, remozó con una inversión de 9.7 millones de pesos, permitiendo que esta comunidad, con una población de 6,200 habitantes, cuente con instalaciones adecuadas para recibir atención de salud oportuna y eficiente.
La remodelación del CPN La Cuchilla incluyó dos consultorios polivalentes, áreas de Vacuna, Urgencias, Farmacia, Sala de Espera y una residencia médica con sala, comedor, dos dormitorios, cocina y baño.

author: Diario de Pernambuco
title: Israel rejeita trégua com Hezbollah e promete lutar 'até a vitória'
text: MUNDO Israel rejeita trégua com Hezbollah e promete lutar 'até a vitória' Israel indicou que matou o chefe da unidade de drones do Hezbollah, Mohamed Srur, em "bombardeios de precisão" no subúrbio sul de Beirute. [AFP](mailto:falecomuai@uai.com.br) Publicado em: 26/09/2024 16:54 | Atualizado em: 26/09/2024 16:57 |Mahmoud ZAYYAT/AFP| Israel prometeu, nesta quinta-feira (26), que continuará lutando contra o movimento islamista Hezbollah no Líbano "até a vitória" e rejeitou um pedido conjunto de um cessar-fogo de 21 dias feito por Estados Unidos, União Europeia e vários países árabes. Pelo quarto dia consecutivo, efetuou uma série de bombardeios contra redutos do Hezbollah no Líbano, enquanto o grupo apoiado pelo Irã disparou mais uma vez projéteis contra complexos militares israelenses. Israel indicou que matou o chefe da unidade de drones do Hezbollah, Mohamed Srur, em "bombardeios de precisão" no subúrbio sul de Beirute. Uma fonte da milícia pró-iraniana já havia informado anteriormente que esse comandante foi o alvo de um ataque na região, que, segundo o Ministério da Saúde libanês, deixou dois mortos e 15 feridos. Os bombardeios também atingiram o leste do Líbano, outro reduto do Hezbollah, onde 20 pessoas, quase todas de nacionalidade síria, morreram na cidade de Yunin, apontou o ministério. "É indescritível, foi uma das piores noites das nossas vidas. Como se houvesse apenas um segundo entre a vida e a morte", disse à AFP Fadia Rafic Yaghi, moradora da região, de 70 anos. O Exército israelense indicou que os seus aviões atacaram nesta quinta 75 alvos do Hezbollah no sul e leste do Líbano e que o grupo islamista havia disparado 80 "projéteis" contra Israel. "Uma chance à diplomacia" Os bombardeios israelenses mataram mais de 600 pessoas desde segunda-feira, incluindo muitos civis, e forçaram 90 mil a fugir das suas casas no Líbano, segundo a ONU. Entre elas, mais de 31 mil entraram na Síria, de acordo com as autoridades libanesas. Desde que começou a guerra na Faixa de Gaza entre Israel e o movimento palestino Hamas, em 7 de outubro de 2023, pelo menos 1.540 pessoas morreram no Líbano devido aos bombardeios israelenses, no contexto dos confrontos transfronteiriços com o Hezbollah, aliado do Hamas. Os duelos de artilharia se intensificaram depois das detonações mortais dos dispositivos de comunicação de membros do movimento libanês, atribuídos a Israel, em 17 e 18 de setembro, e de um bombardeio israelense em 20 de setembro em um subúrbio do sul de Beirute, que decapitou a unidade de elite Radwan do grupo pró-iraniano. Diante da escalada que ameaça arrastar toda a região para a guerra, Estados Unidos, França e outros aliados, incluindo os países árabes, fizeram um apelo conjunto a um cessar-fogo de 21 dias, a fim de "dar uma chance à diplomacia", diz um comunicado divulgado pela Casa Branca. Mas o primeiro-ministro israelense, Benjamin Netanyahu, rejeitou energicamente o apelo e ordenou às suas tropas que continuassem a combater o Hezbollah "com toda a força necessária". Seus ministros das Relações Exteriores e das Finanças, Israel Katz e Bezalel Smotrich (extrema direita), também recusaram a ideia de um cessar-fogo. Israel anunciou em meados de setembro que o "centro de gravidade" da guerra iniciada contra o Hamas se deslocava para o norte, na fronteira com o Líbano. Seu objetivo, afirmou, é garantir o retorno às suas casas de dezenas de milhares de habitantes do norte deslocados pelas hostilidades com o Hezbollah. Guerra total "devastadora" O secretário de Defesa dos Estados Unidos, Lloyd Austin, advertiu que "uma guerra total seria devastadora para Israel e Líbano" e disse que um cessar-fogo no Líbano poderia contribuir para alcançar um acordo de trégua em Gaza. O Hezbollah prometeu continuar combatendo Israel "até o fim da agressão em Gaza". O comandante do Estado-Maior do Exército Israelense, Herzi Halevi, pediu na quarta-feira a seus soldados que se preparassem para uma "possível" ofensiva terrestre no Líbano. O Ministério da Defesa israelense anunciou nesta quinta que recebeu um novo pacote de ajuda militar dos Estados Unidos, no valor de 8,7 bilhões de dólares (47,32 bilhões de reais), "em apoio ao esforço militar" do país. Apesar do agravamento dos confrontos com o Hezbollah, Israel continua sua ofensiva em Gaza, onde a Defesa Civil informou que 15 pessoas morreram no bombardeio de uma escola que abrigava deslocados no campo de Jabaliya, no norte. Este conflito eclodiu com o ataque do Hamas em 7 de outubro, que deixou 1.205 mortos em Israel, a maioria civis, segundo uma contagem da AFP baseada em números oficiais israelenses que inclui reféns que morreram no cativeiro em Gaza. Das 251 pessoas raptadas, 97 permanecem em Gaza, 33 das quais foram declaradas mortas pelo Exército. Em retaliação, Israel lançou uma ofensiva na Faixa de Gaza que já deixou 41.534 mortos, a maioria civis, segundo dados do Ministério da Saúde do governo do Hamas, considerados confiáveis pela ONU.

author: Leo Hohmann
title: Bill Gates’ Dream of Blocking Sunlight About To Be Realized | Frontpage Mag
text: “And that You should reward Your servants the prophets and the saints, And those who fear Your name, small and great, And should destroy those who destroy the Earth.” -Rev. 11:18 Bill Gates, ever the demented snake oil salesman, has long argued in favor of a bizarre plan to fight global warming by using experimental geoengineering to partially block the sun’s rays from reaching Earth. Well, he’s apparently about to get his wish. Scientists plan to begin pumping chemicals into the sky over the next few weeks and months from several countries around the globe, including the U.S., Australia and Israel. The idea, [promoted by](https://slaynews.com/news/cbs-news-pushes-bill-gates-plan-fight-climate-change-blocking-sun/) Gates and leftist billionaire [George Soros](https://slaynews.com/news/george-soros-pushes-plan-fight-climate-change-blocking-sunlight/), involves pumping manmade white clouds containing chalk dust and other chemicals into the atmosphere to reflect sunlight away from the Earth’s surface. Blocking the sun’s light would allegedly lower the planet’s temperature enough to reverse global warming. Never mind that fruit trees and vegetables require sunlight in order to grow and produce food for the masses. Not to mention, sunlight is the primary source of critical Vitamin D, an essential nutrient for human immunity. Gates, a known eugenicist who goes around giving talks about how we need to reduce the global population, likely sees these dark possibilities as exciting side effects of the nefarious sun-blocking plan. Soros is similarly excited about the plan. He says the technology will help to prevent ice from melting in Greenland, which he claims could doom human civilization. How ironic that the very globalists who are doing everything in their power to destroy human civilization claim to be worried that global warming might speed up the process. Globalists like Bill Gates and George Soros are doing harm to the environment through their genocidal climate agenda on multiple levels. They advocate blanketing our fertile farmland with toxic solar panels, while filling more acres of farmland with wind turbines that kill birds and other wildlife. They also push electric cars which run on toxic lithium batteries that are going to create an environmental nightmare in the years ahead because, like with the solar panels, there’s no way to safely dispose of them. Chloe Aiello of Inc. magazine reported on February 13, 2024, that a [Bill Gates-Backed Startup Just Raised $145 Million to Source Lithium-Ion Batteries for Electric Vehicles](https://www.msn.com/en-us/money/smallbusiness/this-bill-gates-backed-startup-just-raised-145-million-to-source-lithium-ion-batteries-for-electric-vehicles/ar-BB1ihVhg). Much of the lithium mined in the world today is done on the backs of child labor in poor countries of Africa and Asia. But don’t tell that to Bill Gates, George Soros, Larry Fink and their buddies at the World Economic Forum. Despite their destructive plans, these globalists insist they are our saviors and we should look to them for answers on how to live a sustainable lifestyle. Please. About the devious sun-blocking formula, Soros said: “Our civilization is in danger of collapsing because of the inexorable advance of climate change. The melting of the Greenland ice sheet would increase the level of the oceans by 7 meters. That poses a threat to the survival of our civilization.” Of course this is all nonsense meant to stoke fear. A fearful population will beg for solutions to the imaginary problem, inviting their own enslavement. More than 20 years ago, Al Gore made the exact same dire predictions about ice melting, polar bears dying, hurricanes increasing, and whole cities being submerged in water. None of these apocalyptic predictions have materialized. According to a report by [Slay News](https://slaynews.com/news/bill-gates-plan-fight-climate-change-blocking-sun-begins/), the tactics advocated by Bill Gates involve spraying aerosol concentrations into the stratosphere to reflect solar radiation away from the Earth. Gates has been funding a major project at Harvard using balloons to deploy aerosols. The Harvard project was shut down following public backlash. But now, the Wall Street Journal is [reporting](https://www.wsj.com/science/environment/geoengineering-projects-cool-planet-weather-f0619bf7) that another group of scientists has been advancing Gates’ idiotic and, frankly, dangerous plan. Marine Cloud Brightening is a research project led by Southern Cross University as part of the $64.55 million, or 100 million Australian dollars, Reef Restoration and Adaptation Program. The program involves modifying clouds to make them reflect sunlight away from the Earth to supposedly stop global warming. Slay News reports: “This week, researchers aboard a ship off the northeastern coast of Australia near the Whitsunday Islands started spraying a briny mixture through high-pressure nozzles into the air in an attempt to brighten low-altitude clouds that form over the ocean. “Scientists hope bigger, brighter clouds will reflect sunlight away from the Earth, shade the ocean surface, and cool the waters around the Great Barrier Reef.” In Israel, another startup called Stardust Solutions has begun testing a system to disperse a cloud of tiny reflective particles about 60,000 feet in altitude. These geoengineered clouds reflect sunlight away from Earth to cool the atmosphere in a concept known as solar radiation management. And, in Massachusetts, researchers at the Woods Hole Oceanographic Institution are preparing to pour 6,000 gallons of a liquid solution of sodium hydroxide, a component of lye, into the ocean 10 miles south of Martha’s Vineyard this summer. Some would argue that “cloud seeding” has been going on for years. Take a look at this shot I took of the sky above my house a few weeks ago. Does the sky in the photo above look normal? With all these chemicals being sprayed above us, what could possibly go wrong? Let’s pray this ill-advised experiment fizzles out before it can do too much damage.
